short.ar: بحث في موقع الويب الحالي فقط
short.am,bn,en,en_AU,en_GB,en_US,et,fa,fil,gu,: A toolbar button to search all pages of any website using Google.
short.ca: Cerca només al lloc web actual.
short.cs: Hledat pouze na aktuální webové stránce.
short.da: Søg kun på det aktuelle websted.
short.de: Durchsuchen Sie beliebige Websites mit Google.
short.es,es_419: Buscar sólo en el sitio web actual.
short.fr: Rechercher uniquement sur ce site Web.
short.hu: Keresés csak az aktuális webhelyen belül.
short.it: Cerca solo in questo sito web.
short.nl: Alleen zoeken op de huidige website.
short.ro: Căutaţi numai în site-ul Web curent.
short.sk: Vyhľadávať len na aktuálnej webovej stránke.
short.sl: Iščite samo po trenutnem spletnem mestu.
short.sv: Sök endast på den aktuella webbplatsen.
short.zh_CN: 一个使用 Google 搜索任意网站所有页面的工具栏按钮。

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,el,es,es_419,et,fi,:
Search any site you're on by the simple click of a button.  The search is done not only on the 1 page you are viewing at the time you click as [Ctrl]+[F] does but instead Google is used to "site search" within ALL pages of the site.  Search websites the easy way!

How to customize:
Right-click the extension's "search this site" button, in the menu that pops up, click on "Options".  There you can:
 ●  change the search engine that's used to search on domains from Google to Yahoo, Bing, or Yandex (a Russian search engine);
 ●  set the button to directly open the search engine instead of a popup, and
 ●  activate the feature to be able to search a domain from the context menu.

Contact:
tobias.schmidbauer@gmail.com
________________________________

CHANGES:
New in this version, version 5:
If you have Chrome version 26 or above, prefilling the search box with the text you selected on a page is enabled by default. This can be disabled in the extension's options.
New in version 4:
Your settings are now synced across your computers.
New in version 3:
Added an option to make the popup look like the one from the "Search within the site" extension, i.e. in it you can choose between subsites.
New in version 2:
An option that the search box will be filled with your text selection.
________________________________

RECOMMENDED EXTENSIONS:

For Firefox, install the add-on "Site Searcher" from
https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/site-searcher/

Recommended to use with Search the current site:
Google Quick Scroll - 
"After you click on a Google search result, Quick Scroll may appear on the bottom-right corner of the page, showing one or more bits of text from the page that are relevant to your query. Clicking on the text will take you to that part of the page."
Get it from:
https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/okanipcmceoeemlbjnmnbdibhgpbllgc
________________________________

KEYWORDS:
"search this site pro"
long.de:
Fügt Ihrem Chrome einen 🔍-Button hinzu.  Den angeklickt, die Suchbegriffe im erscheinenden Popup eingegeben und [Enter] oder ein Klick auf "Suchen" und die geöffnete Website wird durchsucht!

So können Sie die Erweiterung an Ihre Bedürfnisse anpassen:
Klicken Sie mit Rechts auf den Button der Erweiterung in der Toolbar (🔍) und klicken Sie dann im erscheinenden Kontextmenü auf "Optionen".

-----------------------

Sie wollen diesen Button in Firefox?  Dann installieren Sie "Site Searcher" von
http://addons.mozilla.org/addon/site-searcher/
long.en,en_AU,en_GB,en_US,fa,ms:
Search any site you're on by the simple click of a button.  The search is done not only on the 1 page you are viewing as [Ctrl]+[F] does but instead Google is used to "site search" within ALL pages of the site.

How to customize:
Right-click the 🔍 "Search this site" button, then click "Options".  See second screenshot above for what options are available.

________________________________

Want the same functionality for searching websites in Firefox? Install the "Site Searcher" add-on from
https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/site-searcher/
long.he:
Search any site you're on by the simple click of a button.  The search is done not only on the 1 page you are viewing at the time you click as [Ctrl]+[F] does but instead Google is used to "site search" within ALL pages of the site you are viewing at the time.  Search websites the easy way!

How to customize the extension:
Right-click the extension's "search this site" button, in the menu that pops up, click on "Options", which opens up the "Search the current site" options page.  There you can:
 ●  change the search engine that's used to search on domains from Google to Yahoo, Bing, or Yandex (a Russian search engine);
 ●  set the button to directly open the search engine instead of a popup, and
 ●  activate the feature to be able to search a domain from the context menu.
 ●  **New option since version 2.0**:
      When clicking the button, the extension can now use the text you have selected.

Contact:  tobias.schmidbauer@gmail.com

You can use Google's Quick Scroll extension with this. Install it so that when you open sites from a Google search the portions of the page relevant to your search will be highlighted letting you scroll to them instantly.  Get it here in the webstore from
http://goo.gl/xLXW2

For Firefox, install the add-on "Site Searcher" from
https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/site-searcher/
long.ja:
Search any site you're on by the simple click of a button.  The search is done not only on the 1 page you are viewing at the time you click as [Ctrl]+[F] does but instead Google is used to "site search" within ALL pages of the site.  Search websites the easy way!

"表示のサイト内を検索します。 当サイトのように Google のサイト内検索ボックスがあるサイトでしたら サイトデーターを既に google に登録していますので、そちらを使う方がわかりやすいです。" (review from https://mikasaphp.net/chrome_extension2.html)

How to customize:
Right-click the extension's "search this site" button, in the menu that pops up, click on "Options".  There you can:
 ●  change the search engine that's used to search on domains from Google to Yahoo, Bing, or Yandex (a Russian search engine);
 ●  set the button to directly open the search engine instead of a popup, and
 ●  activate the feature to be able to search a domain from the context menu.

Contact:
tobias.schmidbauer@gmail.com
________________________________

CHANGES:
New in this version, version 5:
If you have Chrome version 26 or above, prefilling the search box with the text you selected on a page is enabled by default. This can be disabled in the extension's options.
New in version 4:
Your settings are now synced across your computers.
New in version 3:
Added an option to make the popup look like the one from the "Search within the site" extension, i.e. in it you can choose between subsites.
New in version 2:
An option that the search box will be filled with your text selection.
________________________________

RECOMMENDED EXTENSIONS:

For Firefox, install the add-on "Site Searcher" from
https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/site-searcher/

Recommended to use with Search the current site:
Google Quick Scroll - 
"After you click on a Google search result, Quick Scroll may appear on the bottom-right corner of the page, showing one or more bits of text from the page that are relevant to your query. Clicking on the text will take you to that part of the page."
Get it from:
https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/okanipcmceoeemlbjnmnbdibhgpbllgc
________________________________

KEYWORDS:
"search this site pro"

————

Search any site you're on by the simple click of a button.  The search is done not only on the 1 page you are viewing at the time you click as [Ctrl]+[F] does but instead Google is used to "site search" within ALL pages of the site.  Search websites the easy way!

How to customize:
Right-click the 🔍 "search this site" button, in the menu that pops up, click on "Options".  There you can:
 ●  change the search engine that's used to search on domains from Google to Yahoo, Bing, or Yandex (a Russian search engine);
 ●  set the button to directly open the search engine instead of a 🔍 popup;
 ●  activate the feature to be able to search a domain from the context menu;
 ●  activate the feature that lets you choose between subsites in the 🔍 popup.

____

https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/site-searcher/
